Name: 19th-Century American Sheet Music at UNC Chapel Hill Music Library
Description: Approximately 3,500 popular vocal and instrumental titles from the 1830s to the end of the century. Contains catalog descriptions and digital images of the individual pieces.
Provider(s): University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

Name: 19th-Century California Sheet Music
Description: Sheet music published in California between 1852 and 1900, along with related materials such as a San Francisco publisher's catalog of 1872, programs, songsheets, advertisements, and photographs. Images of every printed page of sheet music from eleven locations have been scanned at 400 dpi, in color where indicated.

Name: African American Sheet Music
Subject(s): 19th-century, 20th-century, African-American, Broadway, colour, lithographs, movie music, popular music, World Wars, Yiddish-American
Description: Sheet music, primarily vocal music of American imprint, dating from the 18th century to the present, with most titles in the period 1840–1950.
Provider(s): John Hay Library at Brown University

Name: ART SONG CENTRAL
Description: Printable sheet music primarily for singers and voice teachers—most downloadable. Emphasis on standard classical and traditional repertoire. IPA transcriptions available for every German, French, Italian and Latin song in the index. Supplementary information on more than 250 songs.

Name: The Ashford Sheet Music Collection
Description: Largely from and about Washington State and the Pacific Northwest.

Name: Bach digital
Description: Johann Sebastian Bach's autograph manuscripts and original parts. Advanced search options. High-resolution scans. Also contains Bach's copies of works by other composers. Comprises at least 90% of extant Bach manuscripts worldwide. Funding provided by the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft and others.
Provider(s): Berlin State Library – Prussian Cultural Heritage, Saxon State and University Library Dresden, Leipzig Bach-Archiv, Leipzig University Computing Center

Name: Beethoven-Haus Bonn Digital Archives
Subject(s): audio, Beethoven, colour, first editions, letters, pictures
Description: Links more than 6,100 documents on 37,300 coloured high-quality scans, 1,600 audio files (including music examples and audio letters), and 7,600 text files.

Name: Biblioteca Digital Hispanica
Description: Downloadable color images.

Name: Biblioteca Nacional Digital Brasil
Description: Sheet music in the Brazilian National Digital Library.

Name: Bodleian Library Broadside Ballads
Description: Printed materials range from the 16th to the 20th Century.

Name: Brahms-Institut
Description: RGB tiff images with a resolution of 1,200 dpi (photos) or 400 dpi (autographs, letters, prints, etc.).

Name: The Cantigas de Santa Maria: Facsimiles
Description: Medieval-era manuscripts written during the reign of Alfonso X "El Sabio" (1221–1284). One of the largest collections of monophonic (solo) songs from the Middle Ages. The To Codex contains roughly the first 100 cantigas, the E Codex all of the cantigas. Illuminations may be found in the E Codex with every 10th cantiga.

Name: The Cello Music Collection of the University of North Carolina at Greensboro
Description: The largest single holding of cello music–related materials in the world, including annotated sheet music (manuscript and published), monographs, serials, audio/video recordings, personal papers, and artifacts associated with noted cellists.
Provider(s): Martha Blakeney Hodges Special Collections and University Archives, UNCG

Name: Charles H. Templeton Sheet Music Collection
Subject(s): 19th-century, 20th-century, American, blues, foxtrots, Irving Berlin, minstrel songs, movie music, popular music, rags, show tunes, war songs
Description: Sheet music for popular tunes dating as far back as 1865. Items are scanned at 600 dpi and saved as a TIFF files.

Name: CHASE research project, University of Leeds, UK
Subject(s): 19th- and early 20th-century performing editions of string music
Description: AHRC-funded research project containing music files viewable on-site or as downloads. Most of the music consists of chamber music and concertos for string instruments, edited and annotated by such players as Ferdinand David, Friedrich Grützmacher, and Joseph Joachim.

Name: Chopin's First Editions Online
Description: All of the first impressions of Chopin's first editions.
Provider(s): Centre for Computing in the Humanities

Name: Chopin Online Catalog
Description: Scores of early printed editions of Chopin's music works published before 1881, of which 74 are works with opus number and 11 are without.

Name: Classical Music Score Digitization Project (CMSDP)
Description: Publicly editable library of public domain music in standardized, machine-parsable formats such as MusicXML, MuseScore, Sibelius, and Finale. Largest public, centralized repository of fully digitized CPP scores.

Name: The Classical String Quartet, 1770–1840
Description: Rare and unusual publications of music for string quartet.

Name: Codices Electronici Sangallenses (CESG) – Virtual Library
Description: Manuscripts from the medieval codices in the Abbey library of St. Gallen. Downloadable colour PDFs and XML files.

Name: The Computerized Mensural Music Editing Project
Description: High-quality early music scores. Online corpus of electronic editions and associated software tools.

Name: Digital Image Archive of Medieval Music (DIAMM)
Description: Images of medieval polyphonic music manuscripts from approximately 800 to 1600. Includes detailed information for all known sources of European polyphonic music (almost entirely vocal), high-resolution colour TIFF images, and links to external images available at other sites.

Name: Digital Scores from the Collections of the Eda Kuhn Loeb Music Library
Description: First and early editions and manuscripts from the 18th and early 19th centuries by J.S. Bach and Bach family members, Mozart, Schubert and other composers. Multiple versions of 19th-century opera scores, seminal works of musical modernism, and music of the Second Viennese School.

Name: The Düben Collection Database Catalogue
Description: Metadata and scanned facsimiles of items in the Düben collection of musical manuscripts and prints from the 17th and early 18th centuries.
Provider(s): Department of Musicology at Uppsala University, Uppsala University Library

Name: e-codices: Virtual Manuscript Library of Switzerland
Description: Medieval and early modern manuscripts from several Swiss libraries, including the Abbey Library of St. Galla.

Name: Early Music Online
Description: Digitised images of over 320 volumes of 16th-century anthologies of printed music, from holdings at the British Library, made available for non-commercial use under JISC's Open Education User Licence.

Name: Frances G. Spencer Collection of American Sheet Music
Description: From the late 18th century to the early 20th century.

Name: Ignaz Pleyel Early Editions
Subject(s): chamber music, French, Ignaz Pleyel, keyboard music
Description: Early printed and manuscript scores of the French composer and music publisher Ignaz Pleyel (1757–1831). Includes arrangements of large orchestral works published within the composer's lifetime.

Name: IN Harmony: Sheet Music from Indiana
Subject(s): downloadable sheet music, open source software
Description: Sheet music and open-source sheet music cataloging software.
Provider(s): Indiana University Lilly Library, the Indiana State Library, the Indiana State Museum, and the Indiana Historical Society

Name: International Music Score Library Project (IMSLP)
Description: Public domain music scores (720,000) and recordings (79,000), including some contemporary composers.

Name: Inventions of Note
Description: Sheet music for popular songs and piano compositions, mostly 1890–1920.

Name: Jean-Baptiste Lully Collection
Description: Rare 17th- and 18th-century scores of operas, ballets, and compilations by the French composer Jean-Baptiste Lully and his sons.
Provider(s): University of North Texas Music Library

Name: Juilliard Manuscript Collection
Description: Autograph manuscripts, sketches, engravers' proofs, and first editions.

Name: KernScores
Description: Scanned graphical music scores (separated by movement), with manually corrected OMR data: Beethoven piano sonatas edited by Paul Dukas. Édition classique a Durand & fils, No. 9327. 1915. Mozart piano sonatas from the Alte Mozart-Ausgabe: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozarts Werke. Kritisch durchgesehene Gesammtausgabe (volume 20 [1878]). Breitkopf & Härtel, Leipzig; 1877–1883. Selected Haydn keyboard sonatas (partial OMR) 34 harpsichord/pianoforte sonatas from the first four volumes published by Universal Edition (1901). D. Scarlatti keyboard sonatas (partial OMR) Edited by Alessandro Longo (Ricordi, 1906–1913).
Provider(s): Center for Computer Assisted Research in the Humanities

Name: Laborde Chansonnier
Description: One book of music from Rare Book Room, which contains digitized books of many types. Laborde Chansonnier – ca. 1470 – Unknown, (author) – France – Library of Congress, Music Division
Provider(s): Rare Book Room of the Library of Congress

Name: Lester S. Levy Collection of Sheet Music
Subject(s): 19th-century, American, minstrel music, popular music, war songs
Description: American popular music spanning the years 1780–1980.

Name: Library and Archives Canada: Sheet Music From Canada's Past
Description: Patriotic and parlour songs, piano pieces, sacred music, and novelty numbers published from before 1900 to 1920. Includes Canadian imprints and music by Canadians or about Canada published anywhere in the world.

Name: The Library of Congress: Historic American Sheet Music: 1850–1920
Description: 19th and early 20th-century American sheet music drawn from the Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collections Library at Duke University.

Name: The Library of Congress: Music for the Nation: American Sheet Music 1870–1885
Description: Historical sheet music registered for copyright, including more than 15,000 registered during the years 1820–1860 and more than 47,000 during the years 1870–1885. Includes popular songs, operatic arias, piano music, sacred and secular choral music, solo instrumental music, method books and instructional materials, and music for band and orchestra.

Name: The Library of Congress: The Moldenhauer Archives
Description: Representative examples documenting the history of Western music from the medieval period through the modern era, including many complete works.

Name: Medieval Music Database
Description: Four complete manuscripts, a gradual, and three antiphonals.

Name: MuseData
Description: Graphical Scores and originating data[1] for: Archangelo Corelli, complete published works, Opp. 1–6 (72 works) Ludwig van Beethoven, complete symphonies, selected string quartets Antonio Vivaldi, concerti grossi other works (Bach, Handel, Haydn, Marcello, Mozart, Rovetta, Teleman)
Provider(s): Center for Computer Assisted Research in the Humanities[2]

Name: Music Australia – Australia's Music: Online, in Time
Description: Music made and played by Australians, most published before 1930. Medium-resolution scans. PDFs available.

Name: Music in the Manuscripts of Bibliothèque Interuniversitaire Médecine of Montpellier
Music Library Digital Scores Collection
Description: Manuscript musical scores dating from the 17th through 19th centuries—mostly 17th and 18th century operas, opera excerpts, and other vocal music.

Name: Music Manuscripts Online
Description: High-quality images and descriptions of music manuscripts.

Name: Musica Brasilis
Description: Music scores by Brazilian composers.

Name: Neue Mozart-Ausgabe: Digitized Version
Description: Musical text and critical commentaries of the entire Neue Mozart-Ausgabe.
Provider(s): Internationale Stiftung Mozarteum, Packard Humanities Institute

Name: Open Music Score
Description: Public domain music scores provided by the user community in MusicXML format.

Name: Penn in Hand
Description: Bibliographic information and digital facsimiles for selected collections of manuscript codices, texts, documents, papers, and leaves held by the University of Pennsylvania's Rare Book & Manuscript Library in the Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books, and Manuscripts, as well as those privately owned by Lawrence J. Schoenberg (C53, WG56).

Name: Project Gutenberg: The Sheet Music Project
Raphael Project
Description: Colour photos, not downloadable.

Name: Répertoire International des Sources Musicales (RISM)
Subject(s): music manuscripts, printed music, libretti, music treatises
Description: Searchable database of over 1.2 million historical musical sources, with a focus on the period between 1600 and 1850. When available, links are included to digitized items in the holding institution's repository.
Provider(s): RISM, Bavarian State Library, Berlin State Library

Name: Sheet Music Consortium
Description: Open collection of digitized sheet music, using the Open Archives Initiative: Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI:PMH). Collections Indexed: Library of Congress, Music Division – 47,528 records Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collections Library, Duke University – 20,157 records Lilly Library, Indiana University – 17,937 records Maine Music Box – 11,779 records Lester Levy Collection, Johns Hopkins University – 11,590 records National Library of Australia – 6,731 records UCLA Music Library – 4,593 records

Name: Sibley Music Library
Description: Public domain scores and books.
Provider(s): Eastman School of Music at the University of Rochester

Name: Tablature in PDF and PostScript
Description: Lute music available in EPS, PDF, MIDI, or TAB format.

Name: Tomas Luis de Victoria
Description: Prints and editions of Victoria, Morales, and some other Spanish composers.

Name: A Traditional Music Library
Description: Traditional and folk music from around the world. Includes downloadable PDF scores and MIDI backing tracks for many of the songs.

Name: Vatican Exhibit Main Hall: Music
Description: Colour JPEGs of Renaissance manuscripts.

Name: Ville de Laon: Bibliothèque Municipale
Description: Music from the 9th to 15th centuries.

Name: Virtual Music Rare Book Room
Description: Emphasis on 18th-century French opera.
